lead_paragraph: The offer appeared to reflect fears in Iraq that the conflict between Saudi Arabia and Iran could aggravate sectarian tensions and hurt the campaign against ISIS.

byline.contributor: Thomas Erdbrink contributed reporting from Tehran.

snippet: The offer appeared to reflect fears in Iraq that the conflict between Saudi Arabia and Iran could aggravate sectarian tensions and hurt the campaign against ISIS.

headline.main: Iraq Offers to Mediate Dispute Between Saudi Arabia and Iran
headline.print_headline: Iraq Offers to Mediate Iran’s Dispute With Saudis

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

abstract: Iraq foreign minister Ibrahim al-Jaafari offers to mediate conflict between Saudi Arabia and Iran stemming from Sunni-majority kingdom's execution of dissident Shiite cleric Sheikh Nimr al-Nimr; fears heightening sectarian tensions in region could disrupt necessary cooperation between Iraq's Sunnis and Shiites in fight against Islamic State.
